thread.title: The Opposing View: Oklahoma Seeks 4th Consecutive Win vs. WVU
thread.title_full: The Opposing View: Oklahoma Seeks 4th Consecutive Win vs. WVU

title: The Opposing View: Oklahoma Seeks 4th Consecutive Win vs. WVU
text: Last updated on October 01, 2015 @ 7:53PM Created on October 01, 2015 @ 7:53PM (Includes comments from sophomore safety Steven Parker, junior quarterback Baker Mayfield & head coach Bob Stoops) While the Mountaineers were running east, west, north and south all over Maryland last week, the Oklahoma Sooners had their feet up during a bye week, giving the OU defense a few extra days to prepare for Dana Holgorsen's offense. And those extra days could prove vital. In their last game, Oklahoma allowed 38 points and 427 passing yards to Tulsa. Sooner signal caller Baker Mayfield is averaging 354 passing yards per game but the OU staff and players know it should be much more difficult to gain traction against a West Virginia defense, and in particular a secondary, that has yielded 23 points in three games. Share
